statements.name: PROC DISPLAYIMAGES
statements.description: The DISPLAYIMAGES procedure accepts an input table that contains image binaries in supported formats (such as JPG, BMP, and so on) and displays the images via the SAS Output Delivery system (ODS).

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: names the input data table for PROC DISPLAYIMAGES to use. The default is the most recently created data table.

arguments.name: TEMPLATE=
arguments.description: specifies a custom template to be used for displaying images. The 'template-string' is the name of the template that you created using the TEMPLATE procedure. By default, TEMPLATE='ACAS.DisplayImages.Default'.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement specifies the name of the variable that contains image identifiers.

statements.name: IMAGE
statements.description: The IMAGE statement lists the name of the variable that contains image binaries, which is typically named _image_. You can also specify the following options after a slash (/):

arguments.name: DIMENSION=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains dimensions of images. By default, DIMENSION=_dimension_.

arguments.name: IMAGEFORMAT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains formats of image binaries. By default, IMAGEFORMAT=_imageFormat_.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains labels of images. By default, LABEL=_label_.

arguments.name: PATH=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains file paths. By default, PATH=_path_.

arguments.name: RESOLUTION=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains resolutions of images. By default, RESOLUTION=_resolution_.

arguments.name: SIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains the image size. By default, SIZE=_size_.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the variable that contains the image type. By default, TYPE=_type_.

statements.name: ORDERBY
statements.description: The ORDERBY statement enables you to specify the order in which the images are displayed. You can specify several variables for ordering data. By default, variables are sorted in ascending order. To specify descending order, include the keyword DESCENDING before the variable name.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: specifies the name(s) of the variable or variables to sort by.

statements.name: RESIZE
statements.description: The RESIZE statement enables you to resize images before you display them. The aspect ratio of the images is maintained by using letterbox resizing with black padding. Images are resized using linear interpolation.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: specifies the height (in pixels) of each image to be displayed. By default, HEIGHT=256.

arguments.name: WIDTH=
arguments.description: specifies the width (in pixels) of each image to be displayed. By default, WIDTH=256.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement enables you to specify a variable-list that outlines the variables to be transferred from the input data table to the Output Delivery System (ODS) for the purpose of displaying them.
